climbs.name: White Paws
climbs.fa: Brad Young, Vicki Young, Brian Hamilton, August 27, 2017

content.description: This 70 foot face climb is on the left northwest face (the one above the back of the large ledge).  Start six feet left of the corner at the back of the ledge.  Thin moves lead to a bolt.  Continue over a protectable, up-and-left crack (½ to one inch).  More climbing, up and slightly right, on excellent rock past six more bolts and a 3½ inch slot (gear), leads to a two-bolt anchor shared with Gorgeous Eyes (listed next).
content.protection: Seven bolts, two pieces from 1/2 to one inch, and one 3 1/2 inch piece.
content.location: As of October, 2017, this is the left-most route at Toller Tower.

climbs.name: Sticks
climbs.fa: Brad Young, Jennifer Wang, Brian Hamilton, Robert Behrens, Steve and Laura Dawson, October 1, 2017

content.description:
Straight up the face between Fanatical Fetcher and Snowballs.  Six bolts are supplemented with small to medium cams.  The route has a separate two-bolt anchor (near the Snowballs anchor, but facing toward this route).

Note: the first ascent party debated long and hard about placing or not placing what is now the route's third bolt. Very good gear is available (and needed) shortly below and above this bolt. The greatly increased possibility of a hard-hitting fall onto a ledge without the bolt led to its placement.
content.protection: Several small to one inch pieces and six bolts.
content.location: Right of center on the northeast face.

content.description: Start from the large ledge, at the left base of the arete that separates Toller Tower’s northeast and northwest faces.  One bolt protects moves up and right, over a discontinuous crack (gear) and onto the arete.  Continue up the arete past four more bolts to a two-bolt anchor on top.
content.protection: Pro: small to one 1¼ inch piece.
content.location: this route climbs the arete which is the most striking part of Toller Tower (starting on the large ledge).

climbs.name: Gorgeous Eyes
climbs.fa: Brian Hamilton, Whitney Reynier, Brad Young, September 16, 2017

content.description: This crack and seam starts just left of the large corner at the back of the large ledge.  Finish to the left of a small pine, at a two-bolt anchor above a slab, 65 feet from the start (the anchor is shared with White Paws).  Protection is hard to place on this route (in seams and flared cracks).  Take small to one-each three and four inch.
content.protection: All gear, from small to one-each three and four inch.
content.location: Start on the large ledge, in its back corner where a northeast and a northwest face meet.

content.description: Fine Feathers is on Toller Tower’s northwest face (to the right of the arete, facing into Broadway Gully).  Start on a large, thin block.  The first bolt protects a mantle onto a stance.  Three more bolts and gear protect varied climbing to a stance on the arete that separates the northwest and northeast faces.  Join Fanatical Fetcher here, at its last bolt (five lead bolts total).  The shared two-bolt anchor is 70 feet from the start.
content.protection: Five bolts, one ½, and one three inch piece.
content.location: This is the only Toller Tower route that does not start from the large ledge; it starts from Broadway Gully.

content.description: This climb is harder than it looks.  Start in a ten-foot high wide crack 10 feet right of Cleaning Up the Yard.  From its top, follow a thin crack/seam over a blocky roof.  Finish up a slab to a small tree.  Descend by walking off or by moving to the White Paws or Sticks anchor and rappelling there.
content.protection: One four inch piece followed by several small to medium.
content.location: The left-most route on Toller's northeast face, starting from the large ledge.

content.description: Start in the short, wide crack/squeeze chimney in the center of Toller Tower’s northeast face.  From a stance at the top of the squeeze, discontinuous cracks (between tightly wedged blocks) lead to an easy slab which leads to the top.  Belay at the same small tree as for Rabid Retriever.
content.protection: One six inch piece and several small to medium.
content.location: In the center of the northeast face, above the large ledge.

content.description: Climb the chimney that starts in the back corner of the large ledge (where the left northwest face meets the northeast face).  Near the top of the chimney a ramp leads up and left to a small tree and the anchor of Gorgeous Eyes and White Paws. Discontinuous and, at  the top, dirty.
content.protection: A few small and medium pieces (although it is probably easier to just skip the rope and protection).
content.location: Start at the same place as for Gorgeous Eyes (on the large ledge, in its the back corner where a northeast and a northwest face meet).
